2.2. Mechanism of Drugs effects on fetus [16] 
Drugs that do not directly cross the placenta may still harm the fetus in following ways:  
 Constricting placental vessels: Some drugs narrow the blood vessels in the placenta, leading to reduced gas 
and nutrient exchange between the mother and the fetus which deprives the fetus of essential oxygen and 
nutrients for proper development.
